content: As we move through 2022, new data from COBALT, additional real-world evidence, information from PBC registries and the publication of the data we presented at ASLD last year, will provide a continuous role of messages on the important role Ocaliva plays as the only approved second-line therapy for patients with PBC. To that end, we were pleased to present pilot data last year at the liver meeting from the Phase III POISE trial open-label extension, which showed that individuals receiving Ocaliva for PBC in the clinical trial setting has statistically longer transplant-free survival when compared to individuals from external databases they were eligible, but who did not receive Ocaliva.
